remarks: Two natural transformations are in a section iff all the components are in a section relation.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Jan-2017.)
statement:
fuciso.q $e |- Q = ( C FuncCat D ) $.
fuciso.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
fuciso.n $e |- N = ( C Nat D ) $.
fuciso.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( C Func D ) ) $.
fuciso.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( C Func D ) ) $.
fucsect.s $e |- S = ( Sect ` Q ) $.
fucsect.t $e |- T = ( Sect ` D ) $.
fucsect $p |- ( ph -> ( U ( F S G ) V <-> ( U e. ( F N G ) /\ V e. ( G N F ) /\ A. x e. B ( U ` x ) ( ( ( 1st ` F ) ` x ) T ( ( 1st ` G ) ` x ) ) ( V ` x ) ) ) ) $.
$d B x $.
$d C x $.
$d D x $.
$d F x $.
$d G x $.
$d N x $.
$d Q x $.
$d U x $.
$d V x $.
$d ph x $.
